description: The long bridge connecting Enies Lobby's main island to the Gate of Justice, where Luffy battles Rob Lucci. It becomes the only structure still standing after the Buster Call destroys the main island.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs. Lucci Battle Continues
keyEvents.description: The intense battle between Luffy and Rob Lucci continues at the first tower of the Bridge of Hesitation as the building collapses around them.
keyEvents.significance: The bridge becomes the stage for the climactic confrontation of the Enies Lobby arc.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Activates Gear Second
keyEvents.description: Underground in the collapsing building on the bridge, Luffy activates Gear Second to match Lucci's incredible power.
keyEvents.significance: The bridge witnesses the full power of Luffy's enhanced form as he pushes himself to the limit.

keyEvents.title: Battleships Surround the Bridge
keyEvents.description: The Buster Call warships position themselves around the Bridge of Hesitation, the only structure still standing after Enies Lobby's destruction.
keyEvents.significance: The bridge becomes the final target of the Buster Call's assault.

statusHistory.reason: The bridge remains standing despite the Buster Call destroying the main island

description: The Judicial Island of the World Government, also known as 'The Island That Never Sleeps' due to its eternal daylight. In this episode, it is systematically destroyed by the Buster Call.

keyEvents.title: Buster Call Fleet Begins Bombardment
keyEvents.description: The Buster Call fleet, led by five Vice Admirals, begins the systematic bombardment of Enies Lobby after all Marines evacuate.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming destructive power of a Buster Call.

keyEvents.title: Battleships Attack Allied Forces
keyEvents.description: Three battleships open fire on Oimo, Kashii, and their passengers at the exit of Enies Lobby.
keyEvents.significance: The apparent deaths of the Straw Hats' allies in the bombardment.

keyEvents.title: Main Island Completely Destroyed
keyEvents.description: The Buster Call battleships report that Enies Lobby's main island has been completely obliterated, with all remaining inhabitants killed.
keyEvents.significance: An entire World Government judicial island that stood for centuries is destroyed in minutes.

statusHistory.reason: Main island obliterated by Buster Call bombardment

description: A World Government ship commandeered by Franky and Robin to serve as the Straw Hats' escape vessel from Enies Lobby. The crew gathers here while waiting for Luffy to finish his battle with Lucci.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Reach the Escape Ship
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat crew members, minus Luffy, successfully make it to their escape vessel.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the crew's successful escape from the main island.

keyEvents.title: Franky's Desperate Plea
keyEvents.description: From the ship, Franky frantically yells for Luffy to hurry up as their allies come under attack.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the vantage point for witnessing the tragedy of the allies' apparent deaths.

statusHistory.reason: Serving as the Straw Hats' escape vessel
